text: Italy is one of the most visited countries, and one of the most beautiful too.
Its gastronomy is world-famous,
Its landscapes are beautiful
And it is full of history.
Are you ready to get to know more about the boot-shaped country?
We will show you the most emblematic places that you should not miss
On your next visit.
You will realize that Italy is not only pizza and pasta.
Italy is much more than that!
No. 1 Tuscany
In the middle of Italy, you can find the beautiful areas of The Tuscany!
You can start your trip to Tuscany in the city of Siena.
Here, you can discover charming medieval villages
Landscapes of rolling hills
Vineyards, and sunflowers fields!
Sounds like a dream!
Well, there is much more!
Beautiful cypress roads lead you to beautiful rural homes
And most important of all, delicious food!
Rent a car, and dedicate yourself to touring this beautiful region for a week.
Let yourself go and explore the most famous cities of the Tuscany region.
No. 2   Florence
Bellisima! There is no other word to describe this city.
This city is the capital of the Tuscany region.
Florence is undoubtedly an open-air museum due to the great architectural gems
Sculptures, and paintings throughout the city.
Leonardo Da Vinci and Michelangelo left their footprints in this place!
In  Florence, you can visit beautiful churches, palaces, and squares.
The Piazza del Duomo, the Cathedral, the campanile, the battistero, Piazza della Signoria, and Palazzo Vecchio.
Places you should not miss on your next visit to Florence.
But if you want to extend your adventure here
You can do it! There are more places to discover.
Do not forget to enjoy the gastronomy of this city.
Delight in masterfully prepared dishes.
No. 3 Pisa
The leaning tower? Yes, it is here!
Nevertheless, we assure you that there are more things to do in Pisa.
This is one of the best places to see in Tuscany.
If you are visiting this city, a mandatory stop is the Piazza Dei Miracoli.
There you can take your picture holding the leaning tower of Pisa.
You can also see the Duomo, the Baptistery, and the Monumental Cemetery.
And if you want to enjoy beautiful views of the square,
Go to the top of the Leaning Tower of Pisa.
Do you want to do more sightseeing?
Head towards the historic center, go through Piazza Dei Cavalieri, where you can find the Palazzo della Carovana.
Then go through the Borgo Stretto, one of the most charming streets in the city,
And end up at the Arno River!
No 4. Venice
In the north of Italy, you can find a unique place in the world.
Venice offers its visitors a dream gondola ride through its canals, narrow streets, stone bridges,
Palaces, and Renaissance churches.
Do you want to know more about the city of canals?
There are more things to do in it.
You can look for the Scala Contarini Del Bovolo, a beautiful spiral staircase.
Visit the famous Bridge of Sighs, named after the sighs of the prisoners who saw the sky and the sea for the last time.
Have a Spritz, Venice's most famous aperitif, and tapas at All'Arco.
Climb the Campanile for the best views in all of Venice.
And before leaving, buy a mask and take-home Venice's most famous souvenir.
No 5. Cinque Terre
The Cinque Terre region is one of the most spectacular in the country.
They are a group of villages located on cliffs and full of colorful houses facing the sea.
They are Vernazza, Corniglia, Monterosso al Mare, Riomaggiore, and Manarola.
The region was also considered a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.
To reach this place, you must take a train from La Spezia or a boat
Where you will have the best views of all the villages except Corniglia, which has no sea view.
In Cinque Terre, you can enjoy its beaches in summer and appreciate beautiful views.
Of course, you should consider that you would need to climb many stairs to enjoy the charms of its villages.
No. 6 Sicily
This Italian island has every right to belong to the list of the best in Italy.
Its gastronomy, culture, nature, and history,
Surrounded by the waters of the Mediterranean, are waiting for you to enjoy them to the fullest.
You should not miss the archaeological sites of Selinunte, Segesta, and Agrigento
As well as the architectural gems of Palermo, Monreale, Syracuse, and Catania.
Landscape lovers will enjoy the beauty of the Etna volcano.
Also the neighboring Aeolian Islands with their beautiful views!
No. 7 Capri
If you want to continue enjoying the sea, you must go to Capri.
The island of Capri is in the Tyrrhenian Sea
Making it one of the best places in Italy to spend the summer.
You can relax and enjoy the turquoise waters surrounding the island.
It is one of the favorite vacation destinations for Italians, Europeans, and travelers all over the world
It is not necessary to have a car since you can walk easily anywhere you need to go
Visit the historic center, go through the Piazzeta and then stroll through the
Streets with stores such as Vittorio Emanuelle, Via Croce, and Camelle.
Capri also has villas such as Villa Jovis, built by the emperor Tiberius
If you like to dive and enjoy the sea, you cannot miss the famous Blue Grotto.
A Grotto, with a depth of 15 to 20 meters, with blue waters where you can swim and fall in love.
No. 8 Rome
Visiting Rome is a must for anyone who loves to travel
And even more so if you decide to visit Italy.
In the eternal city, you will see the architectural wonders of the modern world.
The Colosseum and the Pantheon will take you back to the best times of the Roman Empire.
Rome is a city to stroll through its beautiful narrow streets or neighborhoods with great charm.
In Trastevere, you will find squares such as the Navona or the famous Trevi Fountain
To make your dream wishes come true!
Do not forget to stop by the Vatican and marvel at its museums and the Sistine Chapel!
No. 9 Bologna
This city is popular among students.
But they are not the only visitors. It is also one of the most beautiful tourist sites in Italy.
Bologna is called the red city and to find out why you should see it from above!
The best option is to climb the Asinelli Tower, which you can do for only 3€!
Not only that, the city is full of arcades, galleries, and secret corners to discover.
We are sure it will make Bologna your favorite city in Italy.
Are you hungry? Well, here you can enjoy the specialty!
Some delicious Tagliatelle al ragù
Better known worldwide as pasta bolognese)
Mamma Mia!
No. 10 Pompeii
Are you a history lover?
Pompeii is a place that you have to visit.
This ancient Roman city was buried after the eruption of the Vesuvius volcano in 79 AD.
Pompeii was discovered in the 16th century.
Nowadays, it is one of the best places to visit in Italy to know a piece of its history.
The ruins of Pompeii are in a spectacular state of preservation.
You can visit the ancient Forum
The Amphitheater, the Baths, and the Lupanar
And enjoy the beautiful frescoes that are still in some houses!
Visiting Pompeii from Rome can take 3 hours but from Naples only 30 minutes!
Italy has it all, beaches, delicious food, a lot of history and a lot of art!
That is why it will always be a perfect place to visit if you decide to go to the old continent.
What are you waiting for ?
Italians are friendly people that will make you feel at home,
And we are sure you will always want to come back.
Every place in Italy is special! So be sure to enjoy them to the fullest.
